posts.post_content: I think we'll have to get used to seeing Merfolk creatures with legs. They were allowed to exist in Lorwyn by giving them many streams to swim in, but that can't be done forever. Giving them legs above the water's surface outside of Lorwyn was likely a condition for allowing their future existence as creatures. They will probably still appear underwater with a tail on non-creature cards though.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: You guys are forgetting the best card to pair this with: [Wake Thrasher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wake Thrasher). 4th/5th turn unblockable Thrasher could deal at least 6 damage. Also, they now have legs so that they can print more of them. One of the problems with Merfolk was the flavor of how they fought, and probably caused wizards to explore other races such as Cephalids.

posts.post_content: There isn't anything wrong with it having humanoid legs; in fact I imagine that it can change between fish and human legs at will, probably to decieve other creatures. It also makes sense because how can legless merfolk fight on land if thier confined to water? It would never make sense if my [Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runeclaw Bear) got killed from blocking a merfolk if the merfolk coudn't walk on land. So its perfectly fine that it has normal legs and the rest of you whiny morons who think otherwise can shut the hell up.

posts.post_content:
I personally find merfolk to be ridiculously underpowered compared to kithkin or faeries, between scion of oona, figure of destiny, and what not. If you want to play merfolk though, certainly have to love this one, especially tied in with their champion that lets you take extra turns when it hits the opponent.
  
   
As to how did merfolk move about on land without legs? See card, buoyancy.

currently, there are 10 merfolk in standard, 10 that is it, this card is only good for keeping your merfolk out of fallout range and that is about it, if you even try for a mer strategy, we will see what we get in world wake, but I am not holding out much hope.  
  
this is awesome in extended though, Arthedain named 5 awesome cards to make unblockable, although I prefer the make one of their lands an island and walk on their face (mers have legs, they can walk now (^.^) )

Posted By: Arthedain_the_ranger (8/30/2009 6:16:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Worse out of the new lords. Tap make a merfolk unblockable? WTF?! There is no merfolk that is worth hitting your opponet aside from doing damage. If this base set had a couple kick \*\*\* mers that had 'when this creature deals combat damage to player X happens' then I see it being worthwhile. Also with a set that has whispersilk cloak in it this ability really becomes moot. Equipped creature is unblockable and has shroud. Now if this also gave merfolk shroud then we would be on the way to a new and improved merfolk world safe from Lighting Bots and other targeted removal spells. However after the Scion of Oona and Faerie deck dominated these past couple of years I guess its time from blue to go back into the closet. This is just another way of showing that blue has to pay for the years of having counterspell and ensaring bridge and other cool control decks. 3/5
posts.html:
